class_notes: This class is for students enrolled in the BSHES program only.
course_description: The Capstone seminars provide students with knowledge and skills about the behavioral and social sciences in public health as they are applied to health disparities. Students critically examine the concepts, theories, and methods applied to study a health outcome of interest and evaluate related interventions. Students undertake an independent project that will result in a final 30-50 page paper and an oral presentation.
prerequisites: This class is opened for BSHEMPH students only.
sections: Class Nbr: 3178, Section #: 7, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: F 9-11:50a, Instructor: Standifer/Hazard, Status: Open
